content.text: 2 medium cooking apples, peeled, cored, and chopped
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "2 medium cooking apples, peeled, cored, and chopped" )

content.text: 2/3 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "2/3 cup fresh or frozen blueberries" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon heat-stable granular sugar substitute
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 tablespoon heat-stable granular sugar substitute" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice or ground allspice
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice or ground allspice" )

content.text: 1 1/3 cups whole wheat pastry flour
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "1 1/3 cups whole wheat pastry flour" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1/4 teaspoon kosher salt" )

content.text: 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil" )

content.text: 3 tablespoons low-fat milk
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "3 tablespoons low-fat milk" )

content.text: 0) In a medium bowl combine apples, blueberries, sugar substitute, and the 1/4 teaspoon apple pie spice; set aside.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "combine"@20:27 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "apples"@28:34 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "blueberries"@36:47 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "sugar substitute"@49:65 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "the 1/4 teaspoon apple pie spice"@71:103 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a medium bowl"@6:19 / TOOL )
	)
	:inform ( ac-0-1 "set aside"@105:114 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 1) In another medium bowl stir together whole wheat pastry flour, kosher salt, and the 1/8 teaspoon apple pie spice.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "stir together"@26:39 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-4 "whole wheat pastry flour"@40:64 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "kosher salt"@66:77 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "the 1/8 teaspoon apple pie spice"@83:115 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-1-0 "another medium bowl"@6:25 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Add oil and milk all at once to flour mixture.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "Add"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "oil"@7:10 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "milk"@15:19 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( "flour mixture"@35:48 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Stir lightly with a fork until dough comes together.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Stir"@3:7 / AC
		:instrument ( tool-3-0 "a fork"@21:27 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until dough comes together"@28:54 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Divide dough into 6 portions.
5) Using six 3 1/2- to 4-inch individual tart pans with removable bottoms, press one dough portion on the bottom and up the side of each tart pan.
6) Divide fruit mixture among pastry-lined pans.
7) Place tart pans on a large baking sheet.
8) Place a large piece of foil over tart pans; press down lightly around the edges to seal.
9) Bake in a 375 degrees F oven for 20 minutes; remove foil.
10) Bake about 20 minutes more or until fruit is tender.
11) Let cool in tart pans on a wire rack for 15 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "cool"@8:12 / AC
		:loc ( tool-11-0 "tart pans"@16:25 / TOOL )
		:loc ( tool-11-1 "a wire rack"@29:40 / TOOL )
		:duration ( dur-11-0 "15 minutes"@45:55 / DUR )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Carefully remove sides of tart pans.
13) Serve warm or cool.
